title: Brum do Canto (Dr. Salvador Manuel)
body: Deputy for Madeira in the legislative session of 1906 to 1907. As a lawyer in forensic cases related to this island, he published: Civil ordinary process action. Authors Anthero da Costa Lyra and wife and defendants The Company of Credito Predial and others, 1905, and Civil ordinary process action. Authors Anthero da Costa Lyra and wife and defendants The Company of Credito Predial PortuguÃªs and others, 1907. He died in Lisbon on November 3, 1918, at the age of 33, was the daughter of the judge Dr. Manuel Inacio Brum do Canto and great-grandson of Dr. Luiz Henriques, the first director of our Medical School. He was born in the Azores.

Madeira: Location where Dr. Salvador Manuel Brum do Canto served as a deputy

Anthero da Costa Lyra: Author of the forensic cases published by Dr. Salvador Manuel Brum do Canto
Manuel Inacio Brum do Canto: Judge and father of Dr. Salvador Manuel Brum do Canto
Luiz Henriques: Great-grandfather of Dr. Salvador Manuel Brum do Canto, first director of the Medical School

1906-1907: Dr. Salvador Manuel Brum do Canto served as a deputy for Madeira
1905: Publication of the civil ordinary process action by Dr. Salvador Manuel Brum do Canto
1907: Publication of the civil ordinary process action by Dr. Salvador Manuel Brum do Canto
1918: Death of Dr. Salvador Manuel Brum do Canto
